title: How to Cancel Subscriptions on Steam + Troubleshooting Tips

steps.title: Launch the Steam app.
steps.content: Launch the Steam app. Steam is available to download on Windows, Mac, and Linux. If you aren't already logged into your account, enter your username and password to do so now. If you're using a mobile device, you can go to https://store.steampowered.com/login/ in a mobile browser and log in.

steps.title: Click your username.
steps.content: Click your username. This is in the top-right corner next to the bell-shaped notifications icon and your profile image. A drop-down menu will open when you click on your username.

steps.title: Click Account details.
steps.content: Click Account details . This is the second option. A new page will open. This is also where you can find your account name .

steps.title: Click Manage Subscriptions.
steps.content: Click Manage Subscriptions . This option is between View licenses and product key activations and Update store preferences . [1] X Research source You can find this in the Store & Purchase History box, on the right side of the screen. If you don't see this option, you may have PayPal set as your primary payment method. See our troubleshooting section to cancel via PayPal.

steps.title: Click Edit next to the subscription you want to cancel.
steps.content: Click Edit next to the subscription you want to cancel. You'll see a list of all your active Steam subscriptions. To the right of each subscription, you’ll see the next billing date, the amount due, and the option to edit the subscription. To proceed with the cancellation, select Edit . [2] X Research source Subscriptions can’t be frozen or paused, only canceled—but you can reactivate the subscription anytime you want.

steps.title: Select Cancel my subscription.
steps.content: Select Cancel my subscription . You’ll see a few options based on the payment plans available, and the option to cancel the subscription at the bottom of the list. Select the circle next to the Cancel option, then click Apply . This will cancel the subscription. Steam will only refund subscriptions within 48 hours of the renewal if the content has not been used during the current billing cycle.

steps.title: If you use PayPal, cancel directly on PayPal.
steps.content: If you use PayPal, cancel directly on PayPal. If PayPal is your primary payment method on Steam, you may not see the Manage Subscriptions button. To cancel on PayPal , do the following: Log into the PayPal website or app. Navigate to Settings . Select Payments . Select Automatic payments . Select Steam . Select Cancel . [3] X Research source

steps.title: Contact Steam support.
steps.content: Contact Steam support. If you still can't cancel your subscription, you can contact Steam. Do the following: Open Steam. Select Help in the top toolbar. Select Steam Support . Select Purchases . Select the subscription payment.

steps.title: Select the Community tab on Steam.
steps.content: Select the Community tab on Steam. This will bring you to the main Community Activity page, where you can see popular game hubs and your recently played games. You’ll find the Community tab near the top of the page next to Store and Library on both the Steam app and website.

steps.title: Click the Workshop tab and view all available Workshops.
steps.content: Click the Workshop tab and view all available Workshops. On the Workshop tab, you’ll see a list of popular Workshops. Select the View all available Workshops option at the top of this list, scroll down, and click on the Your Workshop Items section on the right side of the screen. The Steam Workshop hosts player-created content; it’s where you can subscribe to mods for different games.

steps.title: Select Your Files, then navigate to the Subscribed Items tab.
steps.content: Select Your Files , then navigate to the Subscribed Items tab. You’ll see Subscribed Items on the right side of the screen, under Items and Favorited . On the Subscribed Items page, you can view your Workshop subscriptions, rate them, and unsubscribe if you wish. To unsubscribe from an item in your Workshop files, click the button next to it that says Subscribed . When you hover over it, the button will change to say Unsubscribe —and clicking confirms the action. You can also sort your subscriptions by name, date created, date uploaded, or date subscribed.
